member.name: IDockingWindowFrame.AddToolbar
member.summary: Adds the specified object to the frame.
member.param: A pointer to the object to be added.
A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode, application-defined string that is used to identify the docking window object.

param.name: dwAddFlags
param.para: Flags that apply to the docking window object that is being added. One or more of the following values.
The docking window is a regular, visible docking window.
The docking window is added but is not shown. To show it at a later time, call its method.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDockingWindowFrame.FindToolbar
member.summary: Finds the specified object in the toolbar frame and returns an interface pointer to it.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode, application-defined string used to identify the object. This is the same string that was passed to the method.
A reference to the desired interface ID. This is typically IID_IDockingWindow.
When this method returns, contains the interface pointer requested in riid. This is typically . If an error occurs, this value receives a null pointer.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDockingWindowFrame.RemoveToolbar
member.summary: Removes the specified from the toolbar frame.
member.param: Pointer to the object to be removed. The implementation calls the and methods.

param.name: dwRemoveFlags
param.para: Option flags for removing the docking window object. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:
The default delete processing is performed.
In addition to deleting the toolbar, any configuration data is removed as well.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDockingWindowFrame
member.summary: Exposes methods that support the addition of objects to a frame. Implemented by the browser.
